page.title: 04Durie Farm.
page.content: Durie Farm is situated south-east of {Durie House}and south of{Ladyhill plantation.The farm is part of the 1,000 acre Durie Estate owned by Mr.Peter Christie.The farm buildings consist of a farm house,a cowshed,a stable,an implement shed and doocot. The farm has between 150-300 cattle which are stopped from entering the house and grounds by cattle grids.The main crops are wheat,barley and rye.The barley is sent to a Scottish based Canadian firm ,to be made into whisky.Once when the fields were so muddy that the tractor got bogged down so he employed a New Zealand pilot based at an Edinburgh airport to spray his crops.Mr. Christie thought that he was flying too low and was going to hit the electricity pylons.After every flight he had to return to Edinburgh to refuel.
